x = \(\frac{5}{4}\) x 10

text: In this fiqure, PQ = PR = PS and SRT = 68\(^o\). Find QPS
explanation:
Since PQRS is quadrilateral
2y + 2x + QPS = 360\(^o\)
i.e. (y + x) + QPS = 360\(^o\)
QPS = 360\(^o\) - 2 (y + x)
But x + y + 68\(^o\) = 180\(^o\)
There; x + y = 180\(^o\) - 68\(^o\) = 112\(^o\)
QPS = 360 - 2(112\(^o\))
= 360\(^o\) - 224 = 136\(^o\)

text: Find the value of x if \(\frac{\sqrt{2}}{x + \sqrt{2}}\) = \(\frac{1}{x - \sqrt{2}}\)
explanation:
\(\frac{\sqrt{2}}{x + 2}\) = x - \(\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\)
x\(\sqrt{2}\) (x - \(\sqrt{2}\)) = x + \(\sqrt{2}\) (cross multiply)
x\(\sqrt{2}\) - 2 = x + \(\sqrt{2}\)
= x\(\sqrt{2}\) - x
= 2 + \(\sqrt{2}\)
x (\(\sqrt{2}\) - 1) = 2 + \(\sqrt{2}\)
= \(\frac{2 + \sqrt{2}}{\sqrt{2} - 1} \times \frac{\sqrt{2} + 1}{\sqrt{2} + 1}\)
x = \(\frac{2 \sqrt{2} + 2 + 2 + \sqrt{2}}{2 - 1}\)
= 3\(\sqrt{2}\) + 4

text:
Find the non-zero positive value of x which satisfies the equation 
\(\begin{bmatrix} x & 1 & 0 \\ 1 & x & 1 \\ 0 & 1 & x \end{bmatrix}\) = 0
explanation:
\(\begin{bmatrix} x & 1 & 0 \\ 1 & x & 1 \\ 0 & 1 & x \end{bmatrix}\) = 0
To find the value of x, we will have to calculate for the determined of the given matrix and equate it to 0
x[x\(^2\) - 1] - 1[x - 0] + 0[0 - 1] = 0
x\(^3\) - x] - x + 0 = 0
x\(^3\) - x - x = 0
x\(^3\) - 2x = 0
x\(^3\) = 2x
x\(^2\) = 2
take the square root of both sides
x = \(\sqrt{2}\)
